title: The Deed of Re-Conveyance and Status Correction Process
summary: Level 5 teaches the practical foundation of reclaiming your lawful identity through the Deed of Re-Conveyance and related filings. You will learn how this process moves your name and estate back to the land and soil jurisdiction, restoring ownership, responsibility, and sovereignty under public law.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a Deed of Re-Conveyance?
options: To register a new trade name for commercial use
To return the name and estate to the land and soil jurisdiction
To notify a bank of ownership changes
To transfer property to a trust organization

questions.question: In the TSAA lawful process, what does 're-conveyance' literally mean?
options: Recording ownership in a private land registry
Selling a deed to another owner
Moving property back from maritime jurisdiction to land jurisdiction
Cancelling a mortgage agreement

questions.question: Which entity originally claimed ownership over your estate through registration?
options: A foreign corporate government operating under maritime law
A municipal public office of record
The lawful land and soil assembly
Your family trust administrators

questions.question: What key step follows completing the Deed of Re-Conveyance?
options: Recording it publicly on the land and soil jurisdiction
Having it signed only by a notary public
Sending it to the registrar of deeds for approval
Keeping it private for personal safekeeping

questions.question: Why must the Deed be recorded publicly?
options: Because only public record establishes lawful notice and claim of ownership
Because the Assembly requires proof of mailing
Because private filings do not establish intent
Because the courts automatically validate it afterward

questions.question: What additional filings often accompany a Deed of Re-Conveyance?
options: A political status correction and a common carry declaration
Vehicle registration and banking declarations
Municipal tax filings and license renewals
An affidavit of citizenship and employment form

questions.question: What does 'status correction' achieve under TSAA principles?
options: It restores your lawful identity as a living man or woman on the land
It suspends all prior commercial contracts indefinitely
It converts your citizenship into a private trust
It transfers property rights to an international jurisdiction

questions.question: What is the lawful reason for including witnesses on a Deed of Re-Conveyance?
options: To provide living testimony that the act was voluntary and lawful
To add formality so the registrar will file it faster
To show compliance with maritime court procedure
To replace the need for a land notary signature

questions.question: What does TSAA teach about the relationship between the living being and the corporate PERSON?
options: They are two separate entities; the PERSON is a fiction under corporate jurisdiction
They are interchangeable under statutory law
They become the same after status correction
They both operate equally in the public domain

questions.question: Completing and recording your Deed of Re-Conveyance results in:
options: The restoration of lawful title, ownership, and standing under public law
A declaration of financial independence from the Assembly
An application for land grant privileges
The creation of a maritime lien against your estate
